translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Chapter about the One who Worshipped the Buddha with Kaṇvera Flowers
“The Fortunate One named Siddhattha,
the world’s chief, the best of men,
with his disciples in front,
entered the city.
I was in the King’s inner palace,
and was appointed as the cowherd;
I was sitting on the palace,
and I saw the Leader of the World.
Taking a Kaṇvera flower,
I scattered it over the Community of monks;
after making it into a garland for the Buddha,
I scattered it over him again.
For ninety-four aeons,
the flower I worshipped then;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
For seventy-seven aeons,
I was a powerful Universal Monarch,
endowed with the seven treasures,
and great power.
The four analytical insights …
… the Buddha’s instruction has been made successful.”🔽Thus the venerable Kaṇaverapupphiya recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā kaṇaverapupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā kaṇaverapupphiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: The Elder Kaṇaverapupphiya’s Birth Story is finished.
The Second Portion for Recital is finished.
